Now these are the children<S>1121</S> of the province<S>4082</S> that went up<S>5927</S> out of the captivity<S>7628</S>, of those which had been carried away<S>1473</S>, whom Nebuchadnezzar<S>5019</S> the king<S>4428</S> of Babylon<S>894</S> had carried away<S>1540</S> unto Babylon<S>894</S>, and came again<S>7725</S> unto Jerusalem<S>3389</S> and Judah<S>3063</S>, every one<S>376</S> unto his city<S>5892</S>;
Which came<S>935</S> with Zerubbabel<S>2216</S>: Jeshua<S>3442</S>, Nehemiah<S>5166</S>, Seraiah<S>8304</S>, Reelaiah<S>7480</S>, Mordecai<S>4782</S>, Bilshan<S>1114</S>, Mispar<S>4558</S>, Bigvai<S>902</S>, Rehum<S>7348</S>, Baanah<S>1196</S>. The number<S>4557</S> of the men<S>582</S> of the people<S>5971</S> of Israel<S>3478</S>: <sup>Seraiah: also called, Azariah, nehe.7.7.</sup>
The children<S>1121</S> of Parosh<S>6551</S>, two thousand<S>505</S> an hundred<S>3967</S> seventy<S>7657</S> and two<S>8147</S>.

All the Nethinims<S>5411</S>, and the children<S>1121</S> of Solomon's<S>8010</S> servants<S>5650</S>, were three<S>7969</S> hundred<S>3967</S> ninety<S>8673</S> and two<S>8147</S>.
And these were they which went up<S>5927</S> from Telmelah<S>8528</S>, Telharsa<S>8521</S>, Cherub<S>3743</S>, Addan<S>135</S>, and Immer<S>564</S>: but they could<S>3201</S> not shew<S>5046</S> their father's<S>1</S> house<S>1004</S>, and their seed<S>2233</S>, whether they were of Israel<S>3478</S>: <sup>Addan: or, Addon</sup> <sup>seed: or, pedigree</sup>
The children<S>1121</S> of Delaiah<S>1806</S>, the children<S>1121</S> of Tobiah<S>2900</S>, the children<S>1121</S> of Nekoda<S>5353</S>, six<S>8337</S> hundred<S>3967</S> fifty<S>2572</S> and two<S>8147</S>.
And of the children<S>1121</S> of the priests<S>3548</S>: the children<S>1121</S> of Habaiah<S>2252</S>, the children<S>1121</S> of Koz<S>6976</S>, the children<S>1121</S> of Barzillai<S>1271</S>; which took<S>3947</S> a wife<S>802</S> of the daughters<S>1323</S> of Barzillai<S>1271</S> the Gileadite<S>1569</S>, and was called<S>7121</S> after their name<S>8034</S>:
These sought<S>1245</S> their register<S>3791</S> among those that were reckoned by genealogy<S>3187</S>, but they were not found<S>4672</S>: therefore were they, as polluted<S>1351</S>, put from the priesthood<S>3550</S>. <sup>were they: Heb. they were polluted from the priesthood</sup>
And the Tirshatha<S>8660</S> said<S>559</S> unto them, that they should not eat<S>398</S> of the most<S>6944</S> holy things<S>6944</S>, till there stood up<S>5975</S> a priest<S>3548</S> with Urim<S>224</S> and with Thummim<S>8550</S>. <sup>Tirshatha: or, governor</sup>
The whole congregation<S>6951</S> together<S>259</S> was forty<S>702</S> <S>7239</S> and two thousand<S>505</S> three<S>7969</S> hundred<S>3967</S> and threescore<S>8346</S>,
Beside their servants<S>5650</S> and their maids<S>519</S>, of whom there were seven<S>7651</S> thousand<S>505</S> three<S>7969</S> hundred<S>3967</S> thirty<S>7970</S> and seven<S>7651</S>: and there were <S>428</S> among them two hundred<S>3967</S> singing men<S>7891</S> and singing women<S>7891</S>.
Their horses<S>5483</S> were seven<S>7651</S> hundred<S>3967</S> thirty<S>7970</S> and six<S>8337</S>; their mules<S>6505</S>, two hundred<S>3967</S> forty<S>705</S> and five<S>2568</S>;
Their camels<S>1581</S>, four<S>702</S> hundred<S>3967</S> thirty<S>7970</S> and five<S>2568</S>; their asses<S>2543</S>, six<S>8337</S> thousand<S>505</S> seven<S>7651</S> hundred<S>3967</S> and twenty<S>6242</S>.
And some of the chief<S>7218</S> of the fathers<S>1</S>, when they came<S>935</S> to the house<S>1004</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S> which is at Jerusalem<S>3389</S>, offered freely<S>5068</S> for the house<S>1004</S> of God<S>430</S> to set it up<S>5975</S> in his place<S>4349</S>:
They gave<S>5414</S> after their ability<S>3581</S> unto the treasure<S>214</S> of the work<S>4399</S> threescore<S>8337</S> <S>7239</S> and one thousand<S>505</S> drams<S>1871</S> of gold<S>2091</S>, and five<S>2568</S> thousand<S>505</S> pound<S>4488</S> of silver<S>3701</S>, and one hundred<S>3967</S> priests'<S>3548</S> garments<S>3801</S>.
So the priests<S>3548</S>, and the Levites<S>3881</S>, and some of the people<S>5971</S>, and the singers<S>7891</S>, and the porters<S>7778</S>, and the Nethinims<S>5411</S>, dwelt<S>3427</S> in their cities<S>5892</S>, and all Israel<S>3478</S> in their cities<S>5892</S>.
